alert.note: Alert for St. Bernard (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 18 at 6:14PM CDT until May 23 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Louisiana, including the following parishes, Jefferson, Orleans, Plaquemines and St. Bernard. * WHEN...Until 915 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas due to intense rainfall rates. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 614 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen in areas - Additional rainfall amounts of around 1 or more inches is expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... New Orleans, Harvey, Marrero, Timberlane, Chalmette, Belle Chasse, Metairie, Jefferson, Gretna, Harahan, Westwego, Terrytown, Arabi, Bridge City, Elmwood and River Ridge. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
